comment: Pre-review COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title: 'Restructure pipe-dream into submodules'; (2) revision_summary: 'Initial draft' - acceptable for v0.1 per SOP-001 Section 5.1; (3) All 12 CR sections present per SOP-002 Section 6 requirements; (4) No TBD/TODO/FIXME in pre-approved sections 1-9; (5) No typos or formatting errors found; (6) Technical approach sound - git submodules appropriately address the testing paradox while preserving history. Recommend proceeding to pre-approval.

NON-COMPLIANT: Section 10 (Execution) and Section 11 (Execution Summary) contain placeholder content. All 6 EI rows show [SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], and [PERFORMER] - [DATE] placeholders rather than actual execution records. Per SOP-002 Section 7.3, completion evidence must be recorded in the CR before routing for post-review. Physical verification confirms the work was completed (submodules are in place and functional), but the CR document itself has not been updated to document this execution. The initiator must: (1) Update all 6 EI rows with actual execution summaries, outcomes (Pass), and performer/date; (2) Replace the [EXECUTION_SUMMARY] placeholder in Section 11 with an actual summary; (3) Update or remove the placeholder Execution Comments row. Additionally, revision_summary shows 'Initial draft' which should reference the CR ID for v1.0+ documents per SOP-001 Section 5.1. Re-route for post-review after corrections.

Post-review verification complete. All 6 EIs have documented execution summaries with actual implementation details (git subtree split, git filter-repo commands, submodule configuration). All outcomes Pass with performer signatures. Execution Comments table documents observations. Section 11 Execution Summary provides complete narrative. Frontmatter verified: title='Restructure pipe-dream into submodules', revision_summary='CR-030: Restructure pipe-dream into submodules'. No placeholder content. Document structure complete per SOP-002 Section 6. All post-review requirements per SOP-002 Section 7.3 satisfied.
